devanagari:
अहं कृत्स्नं जगत् प्राहुः
अहं कृत्स्नं जगत् प्राहुः
अहं कृत्स्नं जगत् प्राहुः
transliteration:
ahaṁ kṛtsnaṁ jagat prāhuḥ
ahaṁ kṛtsnaṁ jagat prāhuḥ
ahaṁ kṛtsnaṁ jagat prāhuḥ
translation: The whole universe is pervaded by Me; I am the source of all beings and the ultimate goal of all.
purport: In this verse, Lord Krishna asserts His omnipresence, stating that He pervades the entire universe. This highlights the divine nature of Krishna as the ultimate reality. Krishna is not only the source of all beings but also the ultimate goal of all existence. This understanding is crucial for devotees seeking to align their lives with the divine purpose. Recognizing Krishna as the source and goal fosters a deeper connection with Him, encouraging individuals to engage in devotional practices that lead to spiritual fulfillment. This verse serves as a reminder of the interconnectedness of all beings and the importance of realizing one's relationship with the Supreme Lord.
